entries.title: Python Trending Weekly #110: JIT Compiler Two-Year Retrospective, AI Agent Tools Explosion
entries.content:
Welcome to Python Trending Weekly - your gateway to cutting-edge Python intelligence! Curated by Python Cat from 400+ premium sources worldwide, we deliver the most valuable articles, tutorials, open-source projects, tools, podcasts, videos, and trending discussions directly to your inbox. Our mission: Accelerate your Python mastery and unlock new career opportunities in the ever-evolving tech landscape.

Stay ahead of the curve: Subscribe now for weekly insights that keep you at the forefront of Python innovation!

Full article https://www.patreon.com/posts/python-trending-133956776

Here are the title summaries for this issue:

ğŸ¦„Articles & Tutorials

â‘  Reflections on 2 years of CPython's JIT Compiler: The good, the bad, the ugly

â‘¡ Types are Transforming Python

â‘¢ Solving Wordle with uv's dependency resolver

â‘£ Developing a Real-time Dashboard with FastAPI, MongoDB, and WebSockets

â‘¤ Escaping Contravariance Hell

â‘¥ LangFlow Tutorial: Building Production-Ready AI Applications With Visual Workflows

â‘¦ Scaling recommendations service at OLX

â‘§ Getting extensions to work with free-threaded Python

â‘¨ Augmented Coding: Beyond the Vibes

â‘© Context Engineering for Agents

â‘ª PyTorch is dead. Long live JAX.

â‘« operators, not users and programmers

ğŸ¿ï¸Projects & Resources

â‘  trae-agent: LLM-based agent for general purpose software engineering tasks

â‘¡ xai-sdk-python: The official Python SDK for the xAI API

â‘¢ desto: web-interface and cli to manage python and shell scripts in tmux sessions

â‘£ devin.cursorrules: Magic to turn Cursor/Windsurf as 90% of Devin

â‘¤ LingChat: GPT chat with emotional expressions

â‘¥ rowboat: AI-powered multi-agent builder

â‘¦ agent-factory: A tool for generating Python code for agentic workflows

â‘§ throttled-py: High-performance Python rate limiting library

â‘¨ tubearchivist: Your self hosted YouTube media server

â‘© mlx-audio: A text-to-speech (TTS), speech-to-text (STT) and speech-to-speech (STS) library built on Apple's MLX framework

â‘ª sloppy-xml-py: A Python library to parse malformed XML

â‘« Python-Scripts: A curated list of python scripts for automating your tasks

Cut through the noise with our premium subscription at $4.99/month. Get hand-picked, cutting-edge Python content delivered weekly. Join 350+ professionals who trust us to filter the best from 400+ sources for technical vision expansion and career development. Subscribe at: Patreon

After subscribing, you can view the full text of Issue 110 for free: https://www.patreon.com/posts/python-trending-133956776

defÂ handle_route(route: Route, request: Request):

Â  Â  Â  Â  time.sleep(0.2) Â # æ¨¡æ‹Ÿ200mså»¶è¿Ÿ

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  status=200,

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  page.fill("#password","secret_sauce")

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ctx.close()
Â  Â  Â  Â  pytest.parallel(user_flow,Â range(1,users+1))
Â  Â Â withÂ open('mock_perf.csv','w',newline='')Â asÂ f:

importÂ csv, time

fromÂ playwright.sync_apiÂ importÂ sync_playwright
defÂ test_saucedemo_performance():
Â  Â  users =Â 50

Â  Â Â withÂ sync_playwright()Â asÂ p:
Â  Â  Â  Â  browser = p.chromium.launch()
Â  Â  Â  Â Â defÂ user_flow(uid):
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  ctx = browser.new_context()
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  page = ctx.new_page()
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  start = time.time()
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  page.goto("https://www.saucedemo.com")
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  page.fill("#user-name",Â "standard_user")
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  page.fill("#password",Â "secret_sauce")
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  page.click("#login-button")
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â forÂ iÂ inÂ range(5):
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  selector =Â f"#add-to-cart-sauce-labs-{'backpack'Â ifÂ i%2==0Â elseÂ 'bike-light'}"

Â  Â  Â  Â Â # å¹¶å‘æ‰§è¡Œ
Â  Â  Â  Â  pytest.parallel(user_flow,Â range(1, users+1))
Â  Â Â # å†™å…¥æŠ¥å‘Š
Â  Â Â withÂ open('performance_results.csv','w',newline='')Â asÂ f:
Â  Â  Â  Â  writer = csv.writer(f)
Â  Â  Â  Â  writer.writerow(['user_id','duration'])
Â  Â  Â  Â  writer.writerows(results)
Â  Â Â # ç®€å•æ–­è¨€
Â  Â Â assertÂ len(results) == users

fromÂ rdflib importGraph,URIRef
fromÂ rdflib.namespaceimport RDF, RDFS,Namespace, SKOS
importÂ urllib.parse


# å®šä¹‰å‘½åç©ºé—´
schema =Namespace('http://schema.org/')
ex =Namespace('http://example.org/')
rdfs =Namespace('http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#')


# è®¡ç®— Jaccard ç›¸ä¼¼åº¦å¹¶è¿”å›é‡å æœ¯è¯­çš„å‡½æ•°
defÂ jaccard_similarity(set1, set2):
Â  Â  intersection = set1.intersection(set2)
union= set1.union(set2)
Â  Â  similarity =Â len(intersection)/Â len(union)ifÂ len(union)!=0else0
returnÂ similarity, intersection


# åŠ è½½ RDF å›¾
g =Graph()
g.parse('ontology.ttl',Â format='turtle')


defÂ get_article_uri(title):
# å°†æ ‡é¢˜è½¬æ¢ä¸º URI å®‰å…¨çš„å­—ç¬¦ä¸²
Â  Â  safe_title = urllib.parse.quote(title.replace(" ","_"))
returnURIRef(f"http://example.org/article/{safe_title}")


defÂ get_mesh_terms(article_uri):
Â  Â  query ="""
Â  Â  PREFIX schema:<http://schema.org/>
Â  Â  PREFIX ex:<http://example.org/>
Â  Â  PREFIX rdfs:<http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>


Â  Â  SELECT ?meshTerm
Â  Â  WHERE {
?article schema:about ?meshTerm .
?meshTerm a ex:MeSHTerm.
Â  Â  Â  FILTER (?article =<""" +Â str(article_uri) +Â """>)
}
"""
Â  Â  results = g.query(query)
Â  Â  mesh_terms ={str(row['meshTerm'])forÂ rowÂ inÂ results}
returnÂ mesh_terms


defÂ find_similar_articles(title):
Â  Â  article_uri = get_article_uri(title)
Â  Â  mesh_terms_given_article = get_mesh_terms(article_uri)


# æŸ¥è¯¢æ‰€æœ‰æ–‡ç« åŠå…¶ MeSH æœ¯è¯­
Â  Â  query ="""
Â  Â  PREFIX schema:<http://schema.org/>
Â  Â  PREFIX ex:<http://example.org/>
Â  Â  PREFIX rdfs:<http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>


Â  Â  SELECT ?article ?meshTerm
Â  Â  WHERE {
?article a ex:Article;
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â schema:about ?meshTerm .
?meshTerm a ex:MeSHTerm.
}
"""
Â  Â  results = g.query(query)


Â  Â  mesh_terms_other_articles ={}
forÂ rowÂ inÂ results:
Â  Â  Â  Â  article =Â str(row['article'])
Â  Â  Â  Â  mesh_term =Â str(row['meshTerm'])
ifÂ article notin mesh_terms_other_articles:
Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  mesh_terms_other_articles[article]=set()
Â  Â  Â  Â  mesh_terms_other_articles[article].add(mesh_term)

é¦–å…ˆï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°†æ¯ç¯‡æ–‡ç« çš„æ ‡é¢˜å’Œæ‘˜è¦åˆå¹¶æˆä¸€ä¸ªå¤§çš„æ–‡æœ¬å—ï¼Œç§°ä¸ºÂ combined_textï¼š

defÂ combine_abstracts(top_3_articles):
Â  Â  combined_text ="".join(

)

defÂ generate_summary(combined_text):

Â  Â  Â  Â  model="gpt-3.5-turbo-instruct",

Â  Â  raw_summary = response.choices[0].text.strip()

Â  Â  lines = raw_summary.split('\n')

Â  Â  formatted_summary ='\n'.join(lines)

fromÂ rdflib importGraph, RDF, RDFS,Namespace,URIRef,Literal

g =Graph()

schema =Namespace('http://schema.org/')

forÂ p, nsÂ inÂ prefixes.items():

Article=URIRef(ex.Article)

defÂ parse_mesh_terms(mesh_list):
ifÂ pd.isna(mesh_list):
return[]
return[term.strip().replace(' ','_')forÂ termÂ inÂ mesh_list.strip("[]'").split(',')]


# åˆ›å»ºæœ‰æ•ˆ URI çš„å‡½æ•°
defÂ create_valid_uri(base_uri, text):
ifÂ pd.isna(text):
returnNone
Â  Â  sanitized_text = urllib.parse.quote(text.strip().replace(' ','_').replace('"','').replace('<','').replace('>','').replace("'","_"))
returnURIRef(f"{base_uri}/{sanitized_text}")


# ç”Ÿæˆè¿‘äº”å¹´å†…çš„éšæœºæ—¥æœŸçš„å‡½æ•°
defÂ generate_random_date():
Â  Â  start_date = datetime.now()- timedelta(days=5*365)
Â  Â  random_days = random.randint(0,5*365)
returnÂ start_date + timedelta(days=random_days)


# ç”Ÿæˆ 1 åˆ° 10 ä¹‹é—´éšæœºè®¿é—®å€¼çš„å‡½æ•°
defÂ generate_random_access():
returnÂ random.randint(1,10)

# éå† DataFrame ä¸­çš„æ¯ä¸€è¡Œï¼Œåˆ›å»º RDF ä¸‰å…ƒç»„
forÂ index, rowÂ inÂ df.iterrows():

# æ·»åŠ éšæœºçš„å‘å¸ƒæ—¥æœŸå’Œè®¿é—®çº§åˆ«
Â  Â  random_date = generate_random_date()

Â  Â  g.add((article_uri, date_published,Literal(random_date.date(), datatype=XSD.date)))

Â  Â  mesh_terms = parse_mesh_terms(row['meshMajor'])

Â  Â  Â  Â  g.add((article_uri, schema.about, term_uri))

g.serialize(destination='ontology.ttl',Â format='turtle')

fromSPARQLWrapperimportSPARQLWrapper, JSON


defÂ get_concept_triples_for_term(term):
Â  Â  sparql =SPARQLWrapper("https://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/sparql")
Â  Â  query =Â f"""
Â  Â  PREFIX rdf:<http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
Â  Â  PREFIX rdfs:<http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
Â  Â  PREFIX meshv:<http://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/vocab#>
Â  Â  PREFIX mesh:<http://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/>


Â  Â  SELECT ?subject ?p ?pLabel ?o ?oLabel
Â  Â  FROM <http://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh>
Â  Â  WHERE {{
?subject rdfs:label "{term}"@en.
?subject ?p ?o .
Â  Â  Â  Â  FILTER(CONTAINS(STR(?p),"concept"))
Â  Â  Â  Â  OPTIONAL {{?p rdfs:label ?pLabel .}}
Â  Â  Â  Â  OPTIONAL {{?o rdfs:label ?oLabel .}}
}}
"""


Â  Â  sparql.setQuery(query)
Â  Â  sparql.setReturnFormat(JSON)
Â  Â  results = sparql.query().convert()


Â  Â  triples =set()# ä½¿ç”¨ set æ¥å»é‡
forÂ resultÂ inÂ results["results"]["bindings"]:
Â  Â  Â  Â  obj_label = result.get("oLabel",{}).get("value","No label")
Â  Â  Â  Â  triples.add(obj_label)


# å°†æœ¯è¯­æœ¬èº«ä¹ŸåŠ å…¥ç»“æœä¸­
Â  Â  triples.add(term)


returnÂ list(triples)# è½¬ä¸ºåˆ—è¡¨ä¾¿äºå¤„ç†


defÂ get_narrower_concepts_for_term(term):
Â  Â  sparql =SPARQLWrapper("https://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/sparql")
Â  Â  query =Â f"""
Â  Â  PREFIX rdf:<http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#>
Â  Â  PREFIX rdfs:<http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
Â  Â  PREFIX meshv:<http://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/vocab#>
Â  Â  PREFIX mesh:<http://id.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/>


Â  Â  SELECT ?narrowerConcept ?narrowerConceptLabel
Â  Â  WHERE {{
?broaderConcept rdfs:label "{term}"@en.
?narrowerConcept meshv:broaderDescriptor ?broaderConcept .
?narrowerConcept rdfs:label ?narrowerConceptLabel .
}}
"""


Â  Â  sparql.setQuery(query)
Â  Â  sparql.setReturnFormat(JSON)
Â  Â  results = sparql.query().convert()


Â  Â  concepts =set()
forÂ resultÂ inÂ results["results"]["bindings"]:
Â  Â  Â  Â  subject_label = result.get("narrowerConceptLabel",{}).get("value","No label")
Â  Â  Â  Â  concepts.add(subject_label)


returnÂ list(concepts)


defÂ get_all_narrower_concepts(term, depth=2, current_depth=1):
# åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªå­—å…¸å­˜å‚¨æœ¯è¯­åŠå…¶ä¸‹ä½æ¦‚å¿µ
Â  Â  all_concepts ={}


# è·å–è¯¥æœ¯è¯­çš„ç›´æ¥ä¸‹ä½æ¦‚å¿µ

# å¦‚æœæœªè¾¾åˆ°è®¾å®šæ·±åº¦ï¼Œé€’å½’æŸ¥è¯¢ä¸‹ä½æ¦‚å¿µçš„ä¸‹ä½æ¦‚å¿µ
ifÂ current_depth < depth:
forconceptin narrower_concepts:

Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  all_concepts.update(child_concepts)


returnÂ all_concepts
# è·å–æœ¯è¯­çš„åŒä¹‰è¯ï¼ˆæ›¿ä»£åç§°ï¼‰å’Œæ‰€æœ‰ä¸‹ä½æ¦‚å¿µ
term ="Mouth Neoplasms"

# è¾“å‡ºæ›¿ä»£åç§°

# è¾“å‡ºä¸‹ä½æ¦‚å¿µ
forÂ broader, narrowerÂ inÂ all_concepts.items():
print(f"Broader concept:Â {broader}")
print(f"Narrower concepts:Â {narrower}")
print("---")

Â  Â  flat_list =[]

ifÂ narrower_terms:

Â  Â  recurse_terms(concepts_dict)

use rumqttc::v5::{AsyncClient, Event, MqttOptions, QoS};
use rumqttc::v5::mqttbytes::v5::{Publish, PublishProperties};
use tokio::{task, time};
use std::error::Error;
use std::time::Duration;

#[tokio::main]
async fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn Error>> {
    pretty_env_logger::init();

    // è¯·æ±‚å®¢æˆ·ç«¯
    let mut req_options = MqttOptions::new("request-client", "broker.emqx.io", 1883);
    req_options.set_keep_alive(Duration::from_secs(5));
    let (req_client, mut req_eventloop) = AsyncClient::new(req_options, 10);

    // å“åº”å®¢æˆ·ç«¯
    let mut res_options = MqttOptions::new("response-client", "broker.emqx.io", 1883);
    res_options.set_keep_alive(Duration::from_secs(5));
    let (res_client, mut res_eventloop) = AsyncClient::new(res_options, 10);

    // å“åº”å®¢æˆ·ç«¯è®¢é˜…è¯·æ±‚ä¸»é¢˜
    res_client.subscribe("device/control/request", QoS::AtLeastOnce).await?;

    // å“åº”å®¢æˆ·ç«¯å¤„ç†è¯·æ±‚
    task::spawn(async move {
        while let Ok(event) = res_eventloop.poll().await {
            if let Event::Incoming(Event::Incoming(Incoming::Publish(Publish { topic, payload, properties, .. }))) = event {
                if topic == "device/control/request" {
                    let req = String::from_utf8_lossy(&payload);
                    let correlation_data = properties.as_ref().and_then(|p| p.correlation_data.clone());
                    if let Some(corr_data) = correlation_data {
                        let resp_topic = properties.and_then(|p| p.response_topic.clone()).unwrap_or_default();
                        let resp = format!("Processed: {}", req);
                        res_client
                            .publish_with_properties(
                                resp_topic,
                                QoS::AtLeastOnce,
                                false,
                                resp.as_bytes(),
                                PublishProperties {
                                    correlation_data: Some(corr_data),
                                    ..Default::default()
                                },
                            )
                            .await
                            .unwrap();
                    }
                }
            }
        }
        Ok::<(), Box<dyn Error>>(())
    });

    // è¯·æ±‚å®¢æˆ·ç«¯è®¢é˜…å“åº”ä¸»é¢˜å¹¶å‘é€è¯·æ±‚
    req_client.subscribe("device/control/response", QoS::AtLeastOnce).await?;
    task::spawn(async move {
        let properties = PublishProperties {
            response_topic: Some("device/control/response".to_string()),
            correlation_data: Some(b"corr-123".to_vec()),
            ..Default::default()
        };
        req_client
            .publish_with_properties(
                "device/control/request",
                QoS::AtLeastOnce,
                false,
                b"Turn on device",
                properties,
            )
            .await
            .unwrap();
        time::sleep(Duration::from_secs(1)).await;
    });

    // è¯·æ±‚å®¢æˆ·ç«¯å¤„ç†å“åº”
    while let Ok(event) = req_eventloop.poll().await {
        println!("Request Client Received: {:?}", event);
    }

    Ok(())
}

async fn main() -> Result<(), Box<dyn Error>> {

    // è½®è¯¢äº‹ä»¶å¾ªç¯
